abstract: We construct strongly walk-regular graphs as coset graphs of the duals of three-weight codes over Fq.\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\mathbb {F}_q.$$\end{document} The columns of the check matrix of the code form a triple sum set, a natural generalization of partial difference sets. Many infinite families of such graphs are constructed from cyclic codes, Boolean functions, and trace codes over fields and rings.
